strIntroduction: We are a textile weaving company that produces decorative textile for Buddhism, used for religious purposes. You will be able to tour our facilities where we have many huge weaving machines that put strands of silk together one by one to form complicated and amazing patterns and designs. You will also be able to have a hands on experience with one of these weaving machines, and learn how they work. Photo URLs http://voyag.in/1eKDhxW http://voyag.in/IBXc7e http://voyag.in/18j8vrL http://voyag.in/1eRZ3Ax http://voyag.in/18zRZcP http://voyag.in/IIAP0P
strTitle: Nishijin Textile Weaving for Buddhism in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Nishijin is an area in Kyoto, famous for its flourishing textile industry in the olden days. Historical town houses in Nishijin area have high ceilings, and they can also be a shop, a factory and a home all under one roof. In this experience you can get a feeling of the Nishijin atmosphere in our place, a traditional weaving house and living museum about the weaving industry in Kyoto. From replicas of Noh costumes to ancient fashion, you will see all kind of textile from this country. You will get a tour of the textile weaving factory, as well as having a hands on experience with one of the weaving machines. Photo URLs http://flic.kr/p/9Mz4Kq http://flic.kr/p/27ibT2 http://flic.kr/p/87CfPf http://flic.kr/p/87z4z4 http://flic.kr/p/4skhvL http://flic.kr/p/6dDuXv
strTitle: Tour a Nishijin Weaving House & Work on a Weaving Machine

strIntroduction: Are you looking for a different, exciting experience to explore Japan? Do you want to enjoy Lake Biwa in a different way that is the largest freshwater lake in Japan, located in Shiga Prefecture ? How about paragliding above Lake Biwa to overlook the beautiful scenery? If you like this kind of recreational and competitive adventure sport, this is your chance to enjoy the beautiful scenery of Lake Biwa by paragliding. Don't worry if you are a beginner, our instructor will support and give you all the help you need. What are you waiting for? Come on and join this trip! Photo URLs http://voyag.in/18zSFyN http://voyag.in/1bFEGb9 http://voyag.in/1cQY1CV http://voyag.in/Iq0GKu http://voyag.in/1cQY8yo http://voyag.in/1g22YOf
strTitle: Paraglide around Lake Biwa

strIntroduction: Let's eat takoyaki with young Japanese!! Please join me for an authentic Japanese experience, making and eating takoyaki together, and if you like, we will have a drink together too :) I will teach you how to make takoyaki, a traditional kind of Japanese snack made with a wheat-flour based batter, and tako (octopus), served with takoyaki sauce and many possible variations. We can make it exactly how you like! Takoyaki was originally popularized in Osaka but today is enjoyed by people all over Japan. I look forwards to seeing you soon!
strTitle: Takoyaki Night with a Japanese college student!

strIntroduction: If you are tired of ordinary sightseeing,this show should meet your expectation! Japanese style artistic circus show in Tokyo, Japan! Genji (源氏) - The other side of the story - "The tale of Genii" is the oldest Japanese love story, by Murasakishikiubu, which was created a thousand years ago. Lu nagata's breath taking interpretation is a fusion including not only comedy, music and dance performance but also the finest aerial arts and acrobatic movements! Don't miss out this spectacular show!
strTitle: Japanese Artistic Circus Show in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: ようこそ / WELCOME You will be able to join the first everJapanese Traditional Cultural Studies in Tsuyazaki. Celebrating Tsuyazaki's traditional history & culture, beautiful bay and wonderful people, this new event aims to promote Tsuyazaki as Japan's leading local place to national & international visitors. This friendly event includes a wide range of fun and New Year related activities about town. We hope you enjoy this program! ●About Tsuyazaki Tsuyazaki is a small fishing and farming town located next to Fukuoka city in Kyushu. Making salt was prosperous in Tsuyazaki about 100 years ago, and now it is famous for sea turtle laying eggs, a fishing port, the beach, old traditional houses, and it’s love of traditional culture. ●About the Program: 2 or 3 days of fun filled, friendly activities & events in Tsuyazaki — You can study Japanese traditional culture here! ~Program of events~ 1st day : Learn difference of culture （Morning Arrival） 10:00 Meet at Fukuma Sta. 10:30 Kimono wearing and visit Miyajidake-shrine （Afternoon Arrival） 12:00 Lunch 14:00 Free time in Tsuyazaki town (Cycling!) 15:00 Study time Evening Enjoy beautiful sunset & spa（Summer：18:30～20:00、Winter：16:30～18:00） 18:00 Dinner 2nd day : Learn Japanese culture deeply （AM） 07:30 Breakfast 09:00 Study 12:00 Lunch （PM for 2 days participants） 13:30 Finish at Fukuma Sta. （Extra program for 2 days participants） 13:00 Select from option column 18:00 Finish at Fukuma Sta. （PM for 3 days participants） 13:00 Select from option column Evening Enjoy beautiful sunset & spa 18:00 Dinner 3rd day : Learn real Japanese culture and customs 07:30 Breakfast 09:00 Study 12:00 Lunch 13:30 Finish at Fukuma Sta. （Extra program） 13:00 Select from option column 18:00 Finish at Fukuma Sta. *Option column Nature program : Trekking at Mt.Omine / Trekking at Mt.Araji / Cycling / Windsurfing / SUP (Stand up paddle surfing) / Sea kayak / Bird watching / Walking at Oshima Island Daily life program : Visitting at Ainoie / Having dinner at Izakaya(Japanese style pub) Talking program : Study / Talking with local people Seasonal program : Seasonal event / Festivals Experience program : Walking at Miyajidake-shrine wearing Kimono / Woodworking at Tenomori and so on... ●Our Goal: Japanese Traditional Cultural Studies is not just sightseeing tour. Through this program, you can learn what is real Japanese traditional culture. Tsuyazaki will be your second home town. Here has real Japanese traditional life. You can visit us whenever you want after this program! We are family in Japan! ●Staying You can stay Japanese traditional house. It was built 1955. To keep living here we rebuild 2010. You can feel amazing atmosphere. ●Place ■By public transportation From Hakata Sta.(博多駅)：The Kagoshima Main Line(鹿児島本線, JR Kagoshima-honsen) for Moji(門司・門司港) get off Fukuma Sta.(福間駅). From Kokura Sta.(小倉駅)：The Kagoshima Main Line(鹿児島本線, JR Kagoshima-honsen) for Hakata(博多) get off Fukuma Sta.(福間駅). We will pick you up at Fukuma Sta.(福間駅).
strTitle: Join the 2 or 3 days cultural event in Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Surrounded by stunningly majestic nature, you will learn how to do Ikebana and tea ceremony using wildflowers from neighboured mountains. Our living area is called Keihoku, located north of the deep mountain area of Kyoto. When you are tired of the urban atmosphere in central Kyoto, please get on a bus and come to very country area! You will have great mountain view, beautiful air, fresh water and heart-warming local people. What is great about this tour is that you can experience the core of Japanese culture -Ikebana and tea ceremony- together. Furthermore doing mini-trekking and pick some wild flowers for Ikebana; just like old people have done in their daily lives. You can also enjoy wearing Kimono!
strTitle: Enjoy a Tea Ceremony and Ikebana in the Mountains

strIntroduction: Kōdō (香道, "Way of Incense") is the Japanese art of appreciating incense, and involves using incense within a structure of codified conduct. It is one of the 3 major traditional culture of Japan, along side with tea ceremony and calligraphy art. In Kyoto, an ancient city filled with thousands of shrines and temples, incense has developed a deep cultural meaning with its long history. In this experience, participants will learn about the ceremonial practice of Kōdō, different fragrance from incense, the way to hold the incense, and how to "read" different fragrance. This is also a good way to learn about the Higashiyama (east mountain) culture in Kyoto. Open up your sense of smell and join us to learn about "Way of Incense"!
strTitle: Experience with your Nose: Kōdō

strIntroduction: Working as a PR officer for Tokyo collection an other international brands and being a known fashion blog writer i know the high fashion in Japan and where to find them. In this activity i will guide you through Tokyo according to your preferences and wishes. We will visit different stores and sales and i will give you advise on the latest fashion trends. Here is example itinerary for you: 10:30am~11:30am Talk at the cafe called Nicolai Bergmann Since you would like to know about top-notch Japanese designers, I will introduce you to some brands from Tokyo which have been featured during the Fashion Week in Japan. Meeting in Café “Nicolai Bergmann", I will bring along some fashion documents of your favored brands. In the afternoon, I’d like to guide you to the shops you are interested in. 11:30am~1:30pm We will browse boutiques in Aoyama. I’ll take you to Tokyo brand shops like: Commes Des Garcons, Issei miyake, and the selected shops representing typical Tokyo brands. 1:30pm~ Lunch If you like Sushi, I will introduce you the Sushi restaurant in Harajuku, which is very hard to find as it doesn’t have a signboard. This Sushi restaurant buys from the same supplier Ginza Kyubei is getting their ingredients from. You will be amazed by fresh Sushi and the atmosphere, feeling just like a hiding place. We will get the 3000 yen course. 15:00~ We will visit a press sample sale on which you will find your favorite brands and items from 50 domestic and foreign brands. The sample prizes for medium sized pieces will be 70~90 percent off. 16:00~ We will head to your favorite shops you told me about in the morning. ( Most shops are located near Harajuku and Shinjuku) ※Pictures are image. Photo copy right:flickr photo http://flic.kr/p/7cRCQo
strTitle: Dress up to be Classy! Get a Fashion Tour of Tokyo

strIntroduction: Have you visited Keio University before? Keio University is one of the best private universities in Japan. It is located in Minato, which is supposed to be a rich and professional area. A lot of Japanese executives graduated from Keio University. In this activity a current Keio student offers a campus tour in Keio University and guides you through real Japanese campus life.
strTitle: Keio University Campus Tour

strIntroduction: In this activity, I'll guide you around Kyoto for a day. I've been a tour conductor for 32 years and guarantee that you'll have a meaningful experience. You'll see temples, traditional Kyoto architecture and enjoy traditional Japanese food and sweets. Transportation between the different locations in Kyoto will be provided by car. Guided walks are provided with excellent service at each location we stop. *Time Schedule 10:00 I'll pick you up by car at Kyoto station 11:00 Guided walk of Kinkakuji 13:00 Lunch near Kinkakuji 14:00 Guided walk of Kiyomizu-dera 16:00 Cool down at Gion while eating traditional Japanese sweets. 17:00 Visit an observatory that offers excellent Kyoto scenery. 18:00 Drop off at a location you specify.
strTitle: Lets take a Walk in Kyoto
An Afternoon with a Japanese Business Woman

strIntroduction: In this activity, you'll join an international social gathering in Tokyo where you'll surely make amazing friends. Everyone at the party is easy going and friendly and is welcoming to shy people. The party is also a great place to practice your English or Japanese. Why pay all that money to feverishly go to a language school when you can make friends who can be you conversation partner? I don't mean to be pushy, but this party will be unforgettable. So come and let's hang out!
strTitle: Monthly International Social Event

strIntroduction: In this activity, I'll take you to an "onsen" Spa in Tokyo. It's one of the must-do things when you visit Japan. They're very popular and has been a tradition for a long time. The particular spa you'll visit includes try includes five different types of spas and four types of sauna baths. There are also several quiet rooms where you can lay down and relax. **Shampoo, conditioner, soap, towels and shaver are included so you don't have to bring anything in particular.
strTitle: Relaxing Japanese Spa Experience
Trekking at Mt. Takao in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Kendama is a traditional Japanese game played by using a kendama which is made up of the “Ken” (handle) and “Tama” (ball) that's connected by a string. Although a Kendama might look like a simple toy, there are literally hundreds of tricks for you to learn! In this lesson, you will learn many tricks ranging from the basic to more difficult. Let's enjoy playing Kendama together and see how many tricks you can master! If you have any questions, feel free to contact me. I look forward to hearing from you!
strTitle: "Kendama" Lesson with a Kendama Girl in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Do you feel making friends with Japanese locals? If so, you should join us for bowling at one of the biggest bowling alleys in Tokyo! There are many fun features about this particular alley that makes it unique. For example, at random points during the day, there's an event called "strike game" where all the lights shut off except for the alleys. During this event, all the bowlers are supposed to throw the ball at once and if you score a strike, you win a gift as well as a photograph of you and your friends! Also, there's a bowling pin cosplay you can dress up in! Other than bowling, you can also play billiard, karaoke, ping-pong, and arcade games. Join us for a blast!
strTitle: Let's Go Bowling in Tokyo !

strIntroduction: Goukon is a Japanese version of a blind date party, well, sort of. Men and women get together, cook, eat and drink together, and hopefully you meet somebody you like. ;) In this event, we are looking for 5 NON-JAPANESE MEN with 5 JAPANESE WOMEN. If you don’t make it this time... look out for the next one! 【PARTICIPANTS】 5 non Japanese men 5 Japanese women 【MENU】 Salmon and Tuna Tartare with baguettes Grilled pork loin Mushroom and green pea risotto A selection of chocolates Alcohol: wines and beer pairing is included *About Salmon and Tuna Tartare: Instead of using finely chopped raw beef and serving it with capers, onions, and tartare sauce like we do in steak tartare, we prepare this special dish with sashimi-grade salmon and tuna. The sauce is handmade on the spot and goes very well with baguette or rye bread.
strTitle: Go on a Group Blind Date and Learn to Cook in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Let's have a fun time learning about making and eating sushi! Temaki sushi is a cone-shaped rolled sushi that is often eaten in a family/friendly setting. It is perfect for parties. The preparation is really simple: prepare sushi rice (essentially vinegared rice), then cut up fish, nori (seaweed sheets), and vegetables. Lay them all out on large plates and you are done! Everyone will pick whatever they want to eat from the plates, roll the temaki by themselves and dig in. These are spectacular to look at and exciting yet tasty party food! In this 2 hour lesson, you will learn about the ingredients, how to prepare temaki, and you will get to enjoy great sushi while chatting and making new friends. This class is offered in English, but beginner-level English speakers are welcomed.
strTitle: Temaki Sushi Party in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Join a casual meet up group in Tokyo to meet new people and make friends! Our goal is to get people to gather and enjoy conversation in English in a casual, relaxed environment. Even if English is not your first language, you can practice and make new friends along the way. Beginners are welcome, so don't be intimidated (we hear a little booze will do wonders for your basic communication skills). Both local Japanese and non-Japanese currently residing in Tokyo are welcome to join these meet ups. It will be a great way to expand your network! We host this event every week, on Friday evenings and Saturday late afternoons. We look forward to seeing you!
strTitle: Practice your English in Tokyo (with a Drink in Hand!)
Go to the Sakitama Ancient Burial and Make a Magatama!

strIntroduction: If you are visiting Okinawa this summer, It's a good timing to see Eisa Festival! Eisa is Okinawa traditional drum dance. It is holding amss for our ancerstors spirit. You mainly can see it in the summer! Don't miss it! You can join this tour depends on where festival takes place. I am sure this event makes you love Okinawa more and feel like to stay longer here. Let's have fun together! Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/matsuridaikobrasil/6942557319/ http://www.flickr.com/photos/oceant/2703212173/
strTitle: Let's Go to Eisa Festival in Okinawa!

strIntroduction: My place is a guesthouse style accommodation combined with a coworking space where entrepreneurs & freelancers can stay, cowork, exchange ideas with our communities at our many events & parties. While you experience the Japanese way of life, & enjoy Kyoto, the ancient capital of Japan, we, a community of local Ronins will provide valuable information & connection for you to kickoff your project & business right away. It is 20 to 30min to major attractions in Kyoto city, well connected by trains & buses. Groups & organizations are welcome to book the whole of 2F (bedrooms, mini-kitchen, workstation) for study trip & company retreat. Accommodation rooms are named after the 4 Chinese constellation which are also adopted by the Japanese. Genbu (玄武, a black tortise), Seryu (青龍, Azure dragon), Byakko (白虎, white tiger), and Suzaku (朱雀, Vermilion Bird). *Byakko has 4 bunk beds & 1 futon space (Max 5 people) *Seryu has 2 futon space & a mini-kitchen attached. The mini-kitchen will be opened as common space during the day & closed at night. (Max 2 people) *Genbu has 5 futon spaces, it is also attached to the coworking space. It become a common space in the day & sleepng space at night. (Max 5 people) All sleeping spaces are mixed gender, we will try to accommodate if there is any special request. Shared shower & toilet *Suzaku has a shower, a dressing place. Facilities & other info 24/7 access, no curfew Dormitory bed space Futon bed space Workstation: desk & chairs, hammock, whiteboard, projector, screen, printer, wifi Café space Shower x1 (shared) Toilet x2 (shared) Mini-kitchen (shared): microwave, hotwater, coffee machine, IH cooker, pots & pans, fridge Lunch (optional, Mon~Fri) *Bicycle rental (optional, 1000yen per day) Washing machine (200yen per use) Tourism information *Station transfer (for group of 6 or more) Self service coffee (100yen) Foreign adaptors, guide books, padlocks, hairdryer, reading lamps and iPhone charger for free! * Please check for availability with our staff in advance during booking. Cafe Green Cafe Green serves *breakfast, lunch & *dinner. It is also ideal for parties, events & BBQ at the terrasse. You are welcome to join our events there, or create your own event for your group. *reservation needed Apple Kids childcare centre It is a childcare centre for infants & small children, taken care by childcare professionals. You may have peace of mind as you get busy with things while we take care of your children together with other Japanese kids.
strTitle: Global Residential Coworking in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Mountain Biking Tour Kyoto is surrounded by mountain ranges in all directions with rivers & streams running through them. There are many trails linking all these mountains as travellers, monks, hikers had path out all these routes over thousands of years of Japanese history. Besides nature, it is not surprising that you will run into many shrines, temples, Buddha status along the way, and they are usually hundreds or even thousands of years old. On the top of the mountain, sometimes it opens up a view of Kyoto City or Lake Biwa, the largest lake in Japan. Mountains in Kyoto are always dynamic, responding to different seasons of the year, changing its colours and features through out the year. In Spring, you will find spots of pink where the Cherry Blossom blooms. In Summer, a think green forest. It displays a spectrum of red, yellow and orange in Autumn, and it is snow covered in Winter. This mountain biking tour is for anyone who is fit, a regular cyclist and can handle a bicycle to a decent extent. Do not worry if it will be too tough, we can go leisure or sport mode as you prefer. Program • Arrive at our accommodation facility • Check-in, change of clothes, Lunch/ Breakfast (optional) • Prepare bicycle: adjust saddle height, tire pressure, adjust helmet • Warm-up exercise, final briefing • Set-off, Climbs, Break, Decent, tour the area • Return, Shower, Wash up, Rest • BBQ Party with Beer • Overnight stay (optional) Optional places of interest: • Bishimondo Temple • Zuishinin Temple • Daigoji Temple • Oishi Shrine • Lake Biwa Canal • Lake Biwa
strTitle: Mountain Biking in the Forests of Kyoto + BBQ Party

strIntroduction: Let’s explore both old and new cultures of Tokyo (modern Tokyo) and Edo (former Tokyo). We are sure you can experience the different culture through our one day culture tour! Tokyo is more than 400 years old. Finding out about old Edo era’s aspects (1607-1867) and modern ones is very exiting for any tourist. Get ready to discover the traditions of Edo (historical name of Tokyo) starting with Asakusa, one of the most traditional places of Tokyo. Walking through the ancestral Japanese atmosphere you might be surprised at how Japanese religious customs are available to anyone and how Japanese time-honored manners have matured. After visiting the Sumo district called “Ryogoku”, we’ll head to Akihabara, the best place to find the newest and the latest electronic goods Tokyo can offer. Its fever may reveal the “otaku” who is in you. ★On this tour we cover It includes Asakusa walking tour. ■ Asakusa ・Kaminarimon gate ・Nakamise shopping street ・Sensoji temple and Asakusa shrine If you already took part in our Asakusa walking tour, we will arrange a special tour to Kappabashi instead. ■ Ryogoku ・Kokugikan Sumo stadium ・lunch at unique sumo restaurant(there is sumo ring in the restaurant!) ・Edo-Tokyo Museum (You can learn the history and culture of Edo-Tokyo through a variety of reference materials for your fun.) ■ Akihabara Akihabara is famous for the place where electronics were started to be sold in Japan and has a lot of electronics shops now. It is also famous for sub-culture, Japanese pop-culture ・the Parts market ・OTAKU(Geek) street The people who have the intensity or have a lot of knowledge about one field, and fans of game, comics, animation and science fiction are called OTAKU. The pop culture seen in Akihabara is called "Otaku culture". ・Stores for comic, animation and figurine ・Maid-café (costume-themed café) ・Tax free big electronics shops ・Don Quijote(a discount shop) & AKB48 Theater (final place) ■Not included■ ・Transportation fee (Adult: JPY 300, Child under 12: JPY 160) ・Lunch ・Admission fee to Edo-Tokyo Museum (Adult: JPY 600, Child under 12: JPY 300)
strTitle: Tokyo Cultural Tour

strIntroduction: Get the best of Tokyo in a single day! Don’t have enough time to travel around all of Tokyo? Don’t worry! This one day tour is made for people like you who would like to enjoy as much of Tokyo as possible. After completing this tour you will have visited most of Tokyo's major tourist hot spots. ■ ASAKUSA ■ We start with the most popular touristic site of Asakusa area. Asakusa is one of the most traditional places in all of Tokyo. Walking through the ancestral Japanese atmosphere you might be surprised at how Japanese religious customs are available to anyone and how Japanese time-honored manners have matured. You’ll experience the proper way to visit the temple & shrine, how to purify yourself, how to pray, and what a Japanese fortuneteller is like. While at the same time Asakusa is the new symbol of what Japan’s state-of-the-art construction and architecture technology is all about, Tokyo Sky Tree, currently the highest tower in the world is 634 meters tall. ■ The West side of Tokyo ■ After a walk inside one of the most traditional areas of Tokyo, we’ll cross the city to meet the trendy young generation of Japanese in west Tokyo. Open your eyes, you might be surprised! At Shibuya, we’ll see a statue of a loyal dog named ‘Hachi’ and the famous crossing nearby. We'll continue walking around attractive shopping areas like 109, and have a lunch break. If you like to have sushi, we’ll take you to a sushi restaurant. This quite unique sushi restaurant is in Shibuya. Many tourists want to eat sushi here! In the afternoon, we’ll move to Harajuku. We’ll visit Meiji Jingu which is one of the biggest Shinto-related shrines in Japan, and hustle and bustle Takeshita Street filled with teenagers across Japan. You can enjoy its gap between holly atmosphere and secular world. This west tour shows you not only old and new, but also sacred and secular aspects of Tokyo! ★★On this tour we cover★★ ■ Asakusa ・Kaminarimon gate ・Nakamise shopping street ・Sensoji temple and Asaksa shrine If you already took part in our Asakusa walking tour, we will arrange a special tour to Kappabashi instead. ■ Shibuya ・Hachiko dog stature ・Crossing ・Centergai street ・109 ・Lunch ■ Harajuku ・Meiji Jingu Shrine ・Takeshita Shopping Street（Daiso: the biggest 100Yen Shop, Purikura） ★★Let’s talk. “More Knowledge, More Fun”★★ ・The difference between Buddhism and Shinto ・How to pray in a Shinto way ・How Japanese subculture is like ・Japanese traditional wedding ceremony
strTitle: West Tokyo one Day Tour

strIntroduction: You want to walk as local? After walking Asakusa, we’ll go for a stroll in Ueno. We eat lunch in Ameyoko. Then we walk through Ueno park. We’ll end the journey in Yanaka. Yanaka still retains the bustle and the hustle and warmth of old Tokyo. The Yanaka area is a historical place in Tokyo which was developed as a temple town in the Edo period(1603-1867). The people living in Edo (former name of Tokyo) used to visit Yanaka for worship and leisure. Yanaka still retains the charm and warmth of the past.The people in Yanaka are very friendly. It has been a simple residential area for common working people.You will see the commoners’ lives whilst walking around there . There are old temples ,traditional houses and restaurants which offer nice local dishes and drinks.You will see how peacefully many stray cats sit in the narrow alleyways. Let’s discover it together! ★On this tour we cover It includes Asakusa walking tour. ■ Asakusa ・Kaminarimon gate ・Nakamise shopping street ・Sensoji temple and Asakusa shrine If you already took part in our Asakusa walking tour, we will arrange a special tour to Kappabashi instead. ■ Ueno ・Ameyoko shopping street ・Ueno Park ・Shinobazu pond ■ Yanaka ・Tsuiji bei (old style wall from the Edo era) of Kanonnji temple ・Nice small shops (Japanese Chiyogami-Japanese washi paper Traditional sweets, Salted rice crackers) ・Yanaka Ginza (old fashioned shoppingstreet) ・Yuyake DanDan (Sunset stairway Steps) ・Nippori Station (final place)
strTitle: Explore old Style Tokyo Tour (Private)

strIntroduction: Japan's alluring, white-faced, kimono-clad and enigmatic Geishas have long held the imagination of both the East and West. In this activity you will meet these Geishas and have dinner with them. In this activity you will… • Eat a Japanese meal • Receive service from a geisha The service includes pouring you drinks, the Geishas will entertain and serve you while you dine. They will perform a traditional dance with hand fans to music made by Japanese drums and flutes. It's a really unique activity, hard to experience even by Japanese people! Enjoy this incomparable dinner when you visit Japan!
strTitle: Dinner with Geisha!

strIntroduction: It’s good news for the greedy-guts! Don’t you happen to think Sushi and Tempura are only Japanese popular dishes? Absolutely not! There are so many tasty local dishes which Japanese have for lunch such as rice bowls and ramen. Do you have enough time to try all of them? Don’t worry!! Here’s our Tokyo Foodie Tour. You’ll have 5 different dishes in small portion each, so that you can taste them all at once. If you are vegitarian or have food allergies, consult us. We will provide you any other choices as you would enjoy lunch.We buy the popular dishes in each restaurant and share the bites with other tourists. ■You can eat! The 5 most popular local dishes! Ramen Noodle, Curry Rice, Gyudon(Beef rice Bowl), Oyakodon(chicken rice Bowl), eel rice bowl, Special Secret dish and many more! We care of you who cannot eat beef, pork or others. We ask you what you have eaten so far and then we will choose the dishes of the day!
strTitle: Tokyo Foodie Tour

strIntroduction: Why don’t you visit Ueno & Yanaka? Yanaka still retains the bustle and the hustle and warmth of old Tokyo. The Yanaka area is a historical place in Tokyo which was developed as a temple town in the Edo period(1603-1867). The people living in Edo(former name of Tokyo) used to visit Yanaka for worship and leisure. Yanaka still retains the charm and warmth of the past The people in Yanaka are very friendly. It has been a simple residential area for common working people. You will see the commoners’ lives whilst walking around there . There are old temples ,traditional houses and restaurants which offer nice local dishes and drinks. You will see how peacefully many stray cats sit in the narrow alleyways. On this tour we cover ・Shitamachi Museum Annex(The former Yoshida Liquor Shop) ・Ukiyoe museum (wood-block prints museum) ・Tukiji bei (old style wall from the Edo era) of Kanonnji temple ・Atelier for Japanese paintings ・A huge Himalayan Cedar ・Nice small shops (Japanese Chiyogami-Japanese washi paper Traditional sweets, Salted rice crackers) ・The Nezu Shrine ・Hebimichi(Snake street with fashionable shopping street) ・Yanaka Ginza (old fashioned shoppingstreet) ・Yuyake DanDan (Sunset stairway Steps)
strTitle: Ueno & Yanaka Walking Tour

strIntroduction: Here’s a great news for parents of 9-12 year-old children! Would you like to have your children experience a unique “Japanese fake food sample culture”? It can be easy and fun art experience. Have you ever seen Japanese fake food sample in a showcase of restaurants? There are wide varieties of samples such as Sushi, Tempura, Ramen, sweets, Soba noodles with chopstics and pastas with fork. When you see them first, you might not believe your eyes. They look even more real than real food! Food samples are skillful handicrafts which have been loved by Japanese for a long time. Now it shows one aspect of Japanese culture which has an affection of miniaturization and preciseness. In this tour, you’ll enjoy making two samples out of Tempura(shrimp, eggplant, pumpkin, Shiitake mushroom, sweet potato) and a lettuce in an hour. We translate into English!
strTitle: Making Fake Food Sample
Cherry Blossom in Kyushu Cycling Tour (7days)

strIntroduction: There are many types of absurd cafes in Japan. Maid Cafe is one of them, but Cat Cafe is surely one of the most ridiculous and enjoyable ones out there today! At "Cat Cafe", customers are able to have a cup of coffee while playing with a bunch of adorable cats. You can observe the sleeping cats. Play with the cats. Give them snacks. Your choice! Its uniqueness has also given the cafe a lot of media coverage, and is, today, one of the most talked about places in Japan! strIntroduction: Do you know the RAKUGO? Rakugo (comic storytelling) is a traditional Wagei established Japan of the Edo period but has been handed down to the present. Speaker of one person do all the characters and situations such as description of some. This is performing Arts in Japan. Often the story progresses in negotiations of two (or more), speak toward the audience, good use of gestures and voice sound, entertainment are so funny. We are very sure for that make you laugh a lot.. Would you like to have some fun? Go to see the ""RAKUGO"". Japanese traditional story teller gives you the chance to have a different experience. Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/tamaiyuya/3538529339/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/nori_n/2717016378
strTitle: Let's Go to See the "Storyteller" Traditional Japanese Wagei

strIntroduction: ■Morning seaside yoga ・Guests can relax at the best location where the uninhabited island is seen, with the breathing method and the yoga pose. ・Any beginner, guest who has a stiff body or guest with experience can enjoy this class. ・Class open at terrace on a fine day and if it rain, it open at hall. ■Lecturer Marujun(Junko Nakazono) yoga instructor, permaculture designer, copywriter. She learned yoga, Vedanta philosophy, anatomy, qigong and various body exercises in Japan, India and Thailand. She started regular classes in Tokyo from 2004 and instructed in Miyakejima, Ogasawara, Yatsugatake. She also tell about sustainable way of living, like eco-village and transition towns. Translation version "yoga Mara" " Ashtanga Yoga: The Practice Manual" and others. She is publishing a column serially in monthly "Actio". She emigrated to Okinawa in September, 2011. ■Date Sunday: 7:00PM - 8:15PM ■ Adress Maezato1931, Itoman city, Okinawa, Japan Place: Uminchi seaside park

strIntroduction: Do you know seaweed called "sea grapes" very much like a grape of fruit that grows in the ocean? Sea grape is very rare seaweed which can only find under the tropical sun and clean sea around Okinawa. Sea grape is soft and succulent texture that is strange bright green colors. Sea grape has been popular since ancient times around Okinawa as the "longevity grass of the sea". In this experience can be fully proficient in the goodness of the sea grapes. After you have finished tasting sea grapes and you can spend your time relaxing on the beautiful beach. We are very sure to remain in the memories of your life the opportunity to eat something delicious in front of the beautiful beach in Okinawa
strTitle: Experience Taking Sea Grapes
